item.title: The Games Replay
item.description:
The Games Replay

This is my quest to chronicle the history of computer games. Over the next few years, or as long as I still have the interest and patience, I will collect, install, run, play and review every (significantly publicized) game ever made, in chronological order. I will consider all platforms, including computers, consoles and arcades.

item.title: Building Without Nails The Genius of Japanese Carpentry
item.description:
Building Without Nails The Genius of Japanese Carpentry

We've heard of the genius "technology" used in ancient times to build towering monuments with nothing more than primitive tools like stones and ropes. The Egyptian pyramids of old is a great example. Back in the far east, Japan had plenty to offer the ancient world as well when it came to resourceful inventions and crafts.

item.title: Thousands of Amiga games now available to play in your web browser. Here are the best ones - Geek.com
item.description:
Thousands of Amiga games now available to play in your web browser. Here are the best ones - Geek.com

The Internet Archive is at it again, this time uploading a massive collection of over 2,000 classic Amiga games for you to play. These are directly playable in your web browser, no emulator required.

item.title: Christian Faur
item.description:
Christian Faur

The artwork of artist Christian Joseph Faur (or Christian Faur) available on the web
